key_risks: Market sensitivity to CRE volatility, including economic downturns and interest rate fluctuations
Intense competition from major players like CBRE, JLL, and Cushman & Wakefield
Regulatory risks from changes in real estate regulations, tax policies, or lending standards
Dependence on broker network, leading to talent retention challenges and potential conflicts of interest
Legal disputes, such as the Weiler v. Marcus & Millichap case, posing reputational risks
controversies: Legal disputes, including the Weiler v. Marcus & Millichap case
Lack of BBB accreditation, raising questions about customer service and ethical practices
social_issues: Potential ethical concerns due to lack of BBB accreditation
governance_issues: Reliance on broker network and potential conflicts of interest

sources.title: Marcus & Millichap Real Estate Investment Services of Nevada, Inc. v ...
sources.snippet: Marcus & Millichap filed suit in 2016 in federal court to challenge Nevada's system as protectionist and unconstitutional. The trial court ultimately upheld Nevada's law and Marcus & Millichap appealed to the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals. Marcus & Millichap asked the court of appeals to rule that the trial court had erred.
